text: Python: if error raised i want to stay in script
I'm doing some practice problems from online with python and I have a question about how to stay in a script if an error is raised.
For example, I want to read in values from prompt and compare them to a set integer value inside the script.
The only problem is that when someone enters something other than a number 'int(value)' (ex.
value = 'fs') raises an error and exits the script.
I want to have it so if this happens I stay inside the script and ask for another value to be entered at the prompt.
